S0199.Q1. WHAT KIND OF OUTFIT ARE YOU I?  01. RIFLE 02. MACHINE GUN SECTION - LIGHT AND HEAVY 03. MORTAR SECTION 04. TANK CREW 05. GUN CREW - FIELD ARTILLERY 06. ANTI-TANK 07. HEADQUARTERS COMPANY 08. CANNON CO. 09. HEAVY WEAPONS 10. MEDICS 11. TANK DESTROYER 12. ARMORED CAR 13. ANTI-AIRCRAFT 14. BN. HQ. 15. DIV. ARTY. HQ. 16. SIGNAL 17. COMBAT ENGR. 18. M.P. 19. REGIMENT HQ. 20. RECON. PLT. 21. FIELD ARTILLERY MOBILE INCLUDING FORWARD OBSERVERS 00. NO ANSWER

S0199.Q2. ABOUT HOW MANY DAYS ALTOGETHER HAVE YOU BEEN IN COMBAT SINCE THE FIRST OF SEPTEMBER, 1944*  1. NO DAYS IN COMBAT 2. 1-29 DAYS (LESS THAN 1 MONTH) 3. 30-44 DAYS (1 MONTH UP TO 1 1/2 MONTHS) 4. 45-59 DAYS (1 1/2 UP TO 2 MONTHS) 5. 60-74 DAYS (2 UP TO 2 1/2 MONTHS) 6. 75-104 DAYS (2 1/2 UP TO 3 MONTHS) 7. 105-134 DAYS (3 UP TO 3 1/2 MONTHS) 8. 135-149 DAYS (3 1/2 UP TO 4 MONTHS) 9. NO ANSWER

S0199.Q4. IF YOU WERE GOING TO WEAR JUST ONE OF THE FOLLOWING JACKETS FOR WINTER COMBAT USE, WHICH ONE WOULD YOU TAKE AS YOUR FIRST CHOIC?  1.(A) JACKET, COMBAT 2.(B) JACKET, FIELD, 43 (BUSH JACKET) 3.(C) JACKET, FIELD, O.D. 4.(D) JACKET, PILE 5.(E) JACKET, FIELD, WOOL (BATTLE JACKET) 6.(F) MACKINAW 7.(G) SOMETHING ELSE 8. S0199.Q6. HAVE YOU WORN ONE OF THESE COMBAT SWEATERS (SWEATER, HIGH NECK) UNDER FIELD CONDITION?  1. YES, HAVE WORN THIS TYPE SWEATER 2. HAVE WORN OTHER KINDS OF SWEATERS BUT NOT THIS TYPE 3. NO, HAVE NOT WORN ANY KIND OF SWEATER IN COMBAT 0. NO ANSWER

S0199.Q7. DO YOU FEEL THAT MEN IN COMBAT NEED TO WEAR A SWEATER OF THIS TYPE DURING WINTER WEATHE?  1. YES, NEED A SWEATER OF THIS TYPE 2. NEED SOME OTHER TYPE OF SWEATER 3. NO, DON'T NEED A SWEATER FOR COMBAT WEAR 0. NO ANSWER
